intro: Dicoryphe laurifolia, commonly known as the laurel-leafed dicoryphe, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its glossy, lance-shaped leaves that are often arranged in whorls around the stems. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, which bloom in clusters. It is native to Southeast Asia and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in subtropical gardens.
